etymologies: early 17th century: also in the form mumble the peg, from mumble (sense 2 of the verb), from the requirement of the game that an unsuccessful player withdraw a peg from the ground using the mouth

definitions: a game in which each player in turn throws a knife or pointed stick from a series of positions, continuing until it fails to stick in the ground.
shortDefinitions: game in which each player in turn throws knife or pointed stick from series of positions
